text:
e="preserve">Roy Charles Hammond (August 3, 1939 – September 16, 2020), better known as Roy C or Roy "C", was an American southern soul singer-songwriter and record executive. He was best known for his songs "Shotgun Wedding" and "Impeach the President". He was born in Newington, Georgia.
Hammond died on September 16, 2020 in Allendale, South Carolina from liver cancer at the age of 81.
